text: Chitin (C8H13O5N)n (IPA: ) is a long-chain polymeric polysaccharide of beta- glucose that forms a hard, semitransparent material found throughout the natural world. is a semitransparent material that is the main component of the exoskeletons of arthropods, such as crustaceans (e.g. crab, lobster and shrimp) and insects (e.g. ants, beetles and butterflies), of the cell walls of fungi, the radula of molluscs and the beaks of cephalopods (e.g. squid, and octopuses). Chitin has also proven useful for several medical and industrial purposes. == References == == Other websites == * Chitin Product Information from China GreatVista Chemicals * Horseshoe Crab Chitin Research Category:Polysaccharides Category:Macromolecules Category:Natural materials
title: Chitin
